fields.description:
when I try to push or pull from/to my repository, the process take so long, actually it does't even completes, it just returns me this error:

*error: Connection time-out while accessing https://user@bitbucket.org/user/my_repo.git/info/refs\\
fatal: HTTP request failed*

I also tried just

{code}
#!bash

git push
{code}

and the error was:

*error: The requested URL returned error: 403 while accessing https://user@bitbucket.org/user/my_repo.git/info/refs\\
fatal: HTTP request failed*

is it a problem with bitbucket servers, git or my repository itself? It didn't happened before, it started happening these days.

any help?
fields.summary: can't push or pull - Connection time-out while accessing and return error 403

fields.description:
when I try to push or pull from/to my repository, the process take so long, actually it does't even completes, it just returns me this error:

*error: Connection time-out while accessing https://<user>@bitbucket.org/<user>/<repo>.git/info/refs\\
fatal: HTTP request failed*

is it a problem with bitbucket servers, git or my repository itself? It didn't happened before, it started happening these days.

any help?
fields.summary: can't push or pull - Connection time-out while accessing

fields.description:
Watching issues is useless. I get no notifications to Inbox and since I have turned email notifications off, I don't get email notifications either. I don't even know any way to list issues that I'm watching.

There should be a notification when an issue (that is being watched) is updated or commented on.

fields.description:
Allow relative path when including images on wiki, right now when an image is included on the wiki repo the link that has to be used is like this: https://bytebucket.org/user/repo/wiki/path?token=bfe9...

Must be easy as just put the path to the image.

fields.description:
If I try to create a pull request to copy a branch from my fork to upstream (creating a new branch in upstream, not merging to existing one), I get following message:

Diff cannot be displayed

It seems that some or all of the commits that make up this pull request have been removed.

And the request is not mergeable
fields.summary: Pull request to create a new branch doesn't work (BB-7673)

fields.description:
I'm expecting to migrate ~900 private repositories and I'm using the API to audit company groups and permissions.

This endpoint will return a very large response for me and I want to be able to paginate this query with *start* and *limit* variables.
fields.summary: /user/repositories should paginate (BB-7660)

fields.description:
* When I create a group, the permissions set will be propagated to all repositories that an account owns.
* Let's say an another repository admin removes that group from the repository access list;
* Next time I decide to change a group permissions, they will only be set in repositories that still have the group associated, and this go against the fact that the name of the permission is "have 'admin' access to this account's repositories".
* The warning message even tell me that it is applying only to a subset of my account's repositories.

Is this really the expected behavior of this feature?

As an employee of a company that will need to distribute account administration between several project managers because we have ~930 private repositories, this sounds more like a information security flaw. Global permissions should be applied globally and this behavior should not change through time.
fields.summary: Group permissions should be applied on a per-team basis

fields.description:
I've run into a bug using the wiki where I am unable to make a link to a file that exists but is not in a supported format.

This page at https://bitbucket.org/dotnetrdf/dotnetrdf/wiki/DeveloperGuide/Architecture/Design contains a link to a https://bitbucket.org/dotnetrdf/dotnetrdf/wiki/DeveloperGuide/Architecture/Design/dotNetRDF%200.4.1.docx which is a MS Word document stored in the wiki repository.

Whether I include/exclude the file extension BitBucket will report that the file does not exist rather than providing a download for the file.

I explicitly want to store these documents in my wiki because they are documentation and not code files and since my wiki is a repository anyway I should be able to do this.
fields.summary: Cannot link to documents in a wiki not in a recognized format (BB-7665)

fields.description:
I created a team, invited 3 or 4 members, they're in.

I created a Repo and pushed some code.

Everythings fine so far.

I go to the Issue Tracker and create 8 issues for a specific repo, *a repo "watched" only by me*, and assigned each task and bug specifically to myself.

I was informed by each team member that their email got flooded by tasks created by me, for me, for the repo in question.

Should it make more sense to have Issues notifications sent via email only to that Assignee and perhaps Watching members only? (I would still say Watching members may see the issue in their Feed, not so much in their inbox)

Thoughts?

Someone submitted a pull request to my project, and then subsequently closed or deleted the associated repository. Now when I click on the pull request it says "You do not have access to repository bitshifter/premake-stable-linux-findlib-fix so you cannot view the incoming changesets." and I am left with no options to close, delete, or otherwise get rid of the request.

I will contact the user and try to sort it out manually, but it would be nice if there were a button or something to drop the pull request.

If it helps, this is [PR#6|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/pull-requests/6] on premake/premake-stable (currently at https://bitbucket.org/premake/premake-stable/pull-request/6/fixed-osfindlib-on-linux-debian)

Thanks!

fields.summary: managment ui for branches & tags (BB-7589)

fields.description:
Hello...

I hope this is the forum for issues with SPlayer International Version. I followed links from their site to get here.

Background Information:\\
Splayer Version: 3.7

Computer: Dell XPX 1330 with Intel Core Duo T5850 chip.\\
Nvidia GeForce 8400 GS graphics card\\
340 GB hard drive @ 7200 rpm

OS: Windows 7 Ultimate

===========

Issue: When playing movies with SPlayer 3.7.0.2356 (or previous versions), the audio and video will get out of sync. The audio seems to go into "slow motion" mode, while the audio remains at normal speed.

I've checked the CPU usage and it seems to be running at only 30-50 percent, so I don't think SPlayer is overtaxing the CPU.

What I've tried:

# Quit SPlayer and start it again at the previous stopping point:\\
Result: The audio/video will be in sync for a few seconds, then go back out of sync.
# Shutdown computer and restart:\\
Result: Same as above... audio/video will go out of sync after just a few seconds.
# Tried alternate SVideo settings:\\
a. Alternatively checked and unchecked "Use Windows Areo-Glass (for Vista / 7)". Neither setting makes a difference.\\
b. Alternated between "High picture quality mode" and "High performance mode (low-end computers). Neither setting makes a difference.

So how can I fix this? I apologize if I got the wrong forum. It seems you are connected somehow to SVideo, however. If I contacted the wrong group, I ask that you please give me the name of a person or group I can contact to report this bug.

I love SVideo and it is my favorite media player... But the problem with out-of-sync video/audio tracks is making me crazy.

Best regards and thanks,

{code}
    Robert
{code}
fields.summary: Splayer 3.7 video plays out of sync with audio

fields.description:
It has already been noted by dillon (~thedillonb) in the Rest API documentation we lack an ability to interrogate the wiki repo. I have searched and not found that an issue has actually been raised for it. So here it is ! (apologises if i missed it)

It would be useful to request a list of wiki page uris and sub folders for a particular wiki folder.\\
This functionality is already offered for the "src" endpoint.
fields.summary: Rest API to List Wiki pages (BB-7588)

fields.summary: RBZ files are mishandled by Firefox (BB-7586)

Since Google/Twitter/Facebook/Github login is domain bound we can not support OAuth logins with Cnames.

We should remove the buttons for the login view when viewing the site from a cname.
fields.summary: Do not show OAuth buttons when using a cname (BB-7584)

fields.description: My organization uses a particular naming scheme for repositories to keep them organized. The new presentation of sorting by recent activity breaks this and makes it difficult to find and manage repositories.
fields.summary: Allow repository list to be sorted by name on user/team profile (BB-7585)

fields.description:
I'm trying to do some API accesses with an user that have admin access. I want to be able to:

* Capture permission changes events (team_lost_access, team_gained_access, etc) to make an audit log. But API result don't show who lost or gained access, just who made the action.
* As a team account admin user, I'm not able to access events from repositories I own. Is this correct? It seems that the feed exposed is much more complete of information, but harder to parse.

What do you suggest to solve this, I don't fully rely on the documentation, which is outdated. For example, where is the documentation of /users/{account_name}/events?

So far, I'm very frustraded with the API.
fields.summary: API is confusing

fields.description:
Currently when user want to somehow "test" pull request code before approving it it must manually find 2 things: # branch/commit id (switch from diff to commits tab, select commit id which is link and it's far from accessible) # url to "remote" repo to be abble to pull changeset from... Same thing happens when pull request merge encounter "unknown error" issue. Pull requests that have conflicts provide far more usable copy-paste info than "good" & clean ones... To put things even further even clean pull requests have necessary code line HIDDEN in invisible div: {code} #!html
[cut...] hg pull -r 29a03fb79962 ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/user/repo {code} Please provide button that would show this code when user needs it, like in merge buttons line: [ Merge | Manual | Edit | Decline ]
fields.summary: Pull request page should provide hg commands for manual merge (BB-7579)

fields.description: When creating a [static website on Bitbucket|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Publishing%2Ba%2BWebsite%2Bon%2BBitbucket] you cannot name the repository/username with an uppercase letter as accessing the static page at *.bitbucket.org will force the name to lowercase.
fields.summary: Don't force lowercase usernames when using static website pages (BB-7557)

fields.description:
I'm currently receiving a 500 or 502 response when doing a GET request to the https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/_account_/_repository_/tags endpoint.

This has worked just fine until a few days ago when the problem started occurring. Occasionally a requests gets processed correctly, but 99% of the time it just fails.
fields.summary: Server 500 / 502 response when getting tags using the API

fields.description:
Here is run with .pyx.

{code}
#!python

python schafer.py -P intel_mingw32 -m cxgen.pyx -p cxgen32 --bare
{code}

And, the errors are:

{code}
#!python

make: Target `install' not remade because of errors.
* Python built successfully
* Ignifuga engine files are ready.
* Compiling project: cxgen32
* Building cxgen32 for intel_mingw32  (package: cxgen32)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "schafer.py", line 956, in <module>
    locals()["build_project_"+platform](options, abspath(dirname(options.main)))
  File "schafer.py", line 762, in build_project_intel_mingw32
    build_project_generic(options, platform, target, pp, env)
  File "schafer.py", line 609, in build_project_generic
    mod.make(options, env, target, sources, cython_src, cfiles)
  File "/home/Downloads/ignifuga/tools/modules/project/intel_mingw32.py", line 27, in make
    extralibs, options.project)
TypeError: not enough arguments for format string 
{code}
fields.summary: Schafer for intel_mingw32 causes TypeError

fields.description:
Someone who is a follower but is not involved in any of my repositories receives notification when I add someone else as administrator of my account.\\
This creates a hole in privacy.\\
Please provide the feature to remove followers.
fields.summary: Cannot remove a follower (BB-13944)
502 Bad Gateway when using repo zip in pip

fields.description:
Currently _anyone_ can pull from public repositories via HTTPS or SSH _except_ SSH clients authenticated with a development key.

This can of course be worked around by pulling from HTTPS instead, but there is no reason to have such a restriction in place.
fields.summary: Allow deployment keys to pull from public repos (BB-7576)

fields.description:
It would be a nice feature to have the possibility to define URL aliases for a repository (on the repository admin page).

For example if the name/URL changes for some reason this change will break any future pushes (due to changed URL).

The possibility of defining URL aliases would solve this issue, a new URL alias would be defined by the repository administrator when such an alias is needed.

This feature could be also integrated into the repository admin page e.g. when the repository name is changed Bitbucket would automatically ask the user if he/she wants to define an alias for the former repository name as a redirect, something similar to what is happening now when you delete a repository
fields.summary: URL aliases for repositories (BB-7575)

fields.description:
Hi, sorry if I missed something but I can't get a custom domain anymore (I used to but I changed it and it's broken now). Here are the steps I did:

* set a custom domain in my BitBucket account (www.EXAMPLE.org)
* set a CNAME in my registrar account from my "www" to "bitbucket.org." (notice the dot at the end of the URL, I think I'm right)

The dig command says that my www-subdomain links back to BitBucket. But when I try the command "wget -S http://www.EXAMPLE.org/" I get a nasty redirection to "https://EXAMPLE.org" which does not exist (of course since I don't have either the https or the TLD set).

Do you see anything missing in my setup? thank you.
fields.summary: CNAME issue

fields.description:
Hello.

We're working with this private repository: [https://bitbucket.org/promoru/siteindex/|https://bitbucket.org/promoru/siteindex/]

And experiencing strange problems. We've made pull request from our developer's fork, [https://bitbucket.org/slavootic/siteindex/|https://bitbucket.org/slavootic/siteindex/], default branch, to promoru/siteindex default branch. Changes that were made in this fork were not presented in diff during pull request, and merge gave no results too.

For example, we have siteindex/extensions/jcrop/ folder now missing in our repo.\\
It is presented in slavootic/siteindex/ default branch here: [https://bitbucket.org/slavootic/siteindex/src/039386756d2aa25e2a0db2ea76c2b9c22a5288df/extensions?at=default|https://bitbucket.org/slavootic/siteindex/src/039386756d2aa25e2a0db2ea76c2b9c22a5288df/extensions%3Fat%3Ddefault]. And it is not presented in promoru/siteindex/ default branch: [https://bitbucket.org/promoru/siteindex/src/57b7a302ba5eba3244491ce6e1b8dfdba3c36544/extensions?at=default|https://bitbucket.org/promoru/siteindex/src/57b7a302ba5eba3244491ce6e1b8dfdba3c36544/extensions%3Fat%3Ddefault]

But when I'm trying to create Pull Request it still shows me empty diff: [https://bitbucket.org/slavootic/siteindex/pull-request/new|https://bitbucket.org/slavootic/siteindex/pull-request/new] - see screenshot.

This problem is really blocking for us. Could you please explain how this happens?
fields.summary: Bug with pull request and branches
Events Resources showing only recent events

fields.description:
Wiki page should have files browser view. It is very annoying to create seperate wiki pages. It can be sovled by cloning wiki to local computer.

Hope there would be feature like _Google Code_ that has web view for wiki repositories.
fields.summary: Wiki page should have files browser view

fields.description:
logging in with "myopenid" I got an error

13b1fb5445c743b581ed659afbf900b7$d0a2f010fbbc18377054b7b856eda492
fields.summary: myopenid (BB-7570)

fields.description:
Po wypisaniu się z zajęć pomimo ze wcześniej bylem na nie zapisany nie mogę się na nie znów zapisać choć wciąż są jeszcze wolne miejsca.\\
Marcin Duda nr konta 258390
fields.summary: Zapisy

fields.description:
Various projects have to move from opensolaris.org over the next month or so, but access to hg.opensolaris.org is only allowed via ssh for security reasons.

There's a special "anon" (anonymous) account for hg.opensolaris.org that allows ssh pull access and does not require a password or ssh key.

It would be handy if the import code feature allowed this setup.  Here's an example of the public clone steps normally taken for an opensolaris.org repository:

hg clone ssh://anon@hg.opensolaris.org/hg/pkg/gate
fields.summary: import via "anonymous" ssh (BB-7620)

fields.description: I realize some people see value in this - I've had this conversation with a co-worker - but for me, I don't need to receive an email when I do something, as I already know I've done it.
fields.summary: Allow disabling of 'self-made' notifications

fields.description:
When I {{checkout -b my-user/feature-branch}} and then {{git push origin my-user/feature-branch}}, it re-sends all the notification emails.

I am not adding any content to the feature branch yet, simply trying to give it a home.

It is posting another 'comment' to the issue, with the same content as the original, and the same changeset hash.
fields.summary: When pushing a branch, it re-sends all the notification emails

fields.description:
Sometimes when reviewing a commit one will want to browse beyond the default lines that were displayed (by clicking "show more lines") and create a comment there.  When another user wants to view this comment they can click the comment link at the top, which will take them to the default lines that were displayed, but the comment will be still off page for them (they will also need to click "show more lines" to see it, but now they don't know if they need to go up or down, and how far).

When there are "off page" comments, these should be displayed.

I would suggest displaying the comment lines like change lines and displaying them along with the default 3 lines of context.
fields.summary: When viewing a commit, clicking a comment link that was created "off page" ("show more lines") will not display that comment (BB-7569)

fields.description: an URL like this: http://forum.serviio.org/viewtopic.php?f=42&t=5192 encoded the ampersand to & and clicking on it fails to open the URL
fields.summary: URLs in issue tracker are incorrectly escaped

fields.description:
https://bitbucket.org/BattleClinic/evemon/downloads/EVEMon-install-1.7.0.3809.exe\\
no file?
fields.summary: missing file

fields.description: It seems like if I register an account with an academic email, then switch to another email account, and re-register with the same academic email, I get Academic plan level on both accounts. Shouldn't the plan level track the available email addresses for the account (or track the primary email) ?
fields.summary: Academic plan level (BB-7568)

fields.description:
It'd be great to have the ability to create custom filters (screenshot: http://cl.ly/MxMo )\\
It's like a saved rules for Advanced Search, compiled into a filter button.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Feature request - custom buttons for issues filtering (BB-7567)

fields.description:
While markdown tables are properly converted to HTML tables, they lack of important css styles, like borders. This causes the table to look like plain text.

Sample markdown table:

||Row1 Cell1||Row1 Cell2||
|Row1 Cell1|Row1 Cell2|
|Row2 Cell1|Row2 Cell2|
fields.summary: Markdown tables not being properly styled (BB-9928)

fields.description: Like [github|https://github.com/github/github-services], it would be amazing if bitbucket would open source their services to allow others to contribute to the many services that can be provided.
fields.summary: Open source service hooks

fields.description:
Hi,

I manage a repository for my project.  I created branches/tress to pull/update some other open sources projects.\\
When I merge the different projects with mine, I merge also the comments/commits.\\
I just added a new project (facebook-csharp-sdk) and pushed the project on my bitbucket repository.\\
And this project updated also my own open issues (which was merged with issues from facebook-csharp-sdk).  I don't understand why

Greetings,\\
Hugo Terelle
fields.summary: Merging my repository with a remote repository create conflicts in Issues

fields.description:
*Reproduce*

# Add several issues having different priorities to a project.
# View the issues summary page.
# Click the *P* (between *T* and *Status*) to sort the priority.

*Expected Results*

The highest priority items are shown first.

*Actual Results*

The lowest priority items are shown first.

*Work Around*

Click the *P* again...
fields.summary: Priority Sort is Backwards (BB-7565)

fields.description:
Basically, I'm doing this on OSX

$ git --version\\
git version 1.7.9.6 (Apple Git-31.1)

$ git push -u origin --all\\
Warning: Permanently added the RSA host key for IP address '207.223.240.181' to the list of known hosts.\\
Counting objects: 14912, done.\\
Delta compression using up to 8 threads.\\
Compressing objects: 100% (4259/4259), done.\\
Write failed: Broken pipe25/14912), 6.64 MiB | 88 KiB/s\\
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly\\
error: pack-objects died of signal 13\\
error: failed to push some refs to 'ssh://git@bitbucket.org/yzhang/reponame.git'
fields.summary: git push with ssh causes remote end to hang up

fields.description: Cuando se llena la barra azul falla la descarga aunque ya esta totalmente llena.
fields.summary: falla de descarga / download failed

fields.description:
https://bitbucket.org/jhgarrison/sysconfig/src/e6d700ecc483/helios/etc/httpd/conf.d?at=master

I committed and pushed a new file (tomcat.conf) and was able to pull from a second system, but the UI does not show the file.  I have refreshed multiple times.  See attached screenshot.

After logging out and logging back in, the file showed up in the UI.
fields.summary: Web UI not reflecting git updates
